title: CLI Flags & Options
description: Command-line flags and options available in Claude Code

commands.name: --print, -p
commands.description: Prints the response directly to the console and exits, rather than entering the interactive REPL mode.

commands.name: --output-format
commands.description: Specifies the output format for responses. Options are 'text' (default), 'json', or 'stream-json'.

commands.name: --verbose
commands.description: Enables verbose logging, showing detailed turn-by-turn output, which is useful for debugging conversations.

commands.name: --debug, -d
commands.description: Enables debug mode, providing extensive logging for troubleshooting and development.

commands.name: --input-format
commands.description: Specifies the input format for piped data. Only works with --print. Options: 'text' (default) or 'stream-json'.

commands.name: --mcp-debug
commands.description: Enables MCP debug mode. This flag is deprecated; please use the more general --debug flag instead.

commands.name: --mcp-config
commands.description: Loads MCP server configurations from a specified JSON file or a raw JSON string.

commands.name: --resume, -r
commands.description: Resumes a conversation. Provide a session ID or select a conversation interactively to restore its context.

commands.name: --continue, -c
commands.description: Continues the most recent conversation from your session history, making it easy to pick up where you left off.

commands.name: --dangerously-skip-permissions
commands.description: Bypass all permission checks. Recommended only for sandboxes with no internet access.

commands.name: --allowedTools
commands.description: Specifies a comma-separated list of tools that Claude is permitted to use during the session.

commands.name: --disallowedTools
commands.description: Specifies a comma-separated list of tools that Claude is blocked from using during the session.

commands.name: --add-dir
commands.description: Additional directories to allow tool access to (must be absolute paths).

commands.name: --model
commands.description: Model for the current session. Provide an alias for the latest model (e.g. 'sonnet' or 'opus') or a model's full name (e.g. 'claude-sonnet-4-20250514').

commands.name: --version, -v
commands.description: Outputs the current version number of your installed Claude Code CLI.

commands.name: --help, -h
commands.description: Displays comprehensive help information for a command or the CLI in general.

commands.name: --max-turns
commands.description: Limits the number of agentic turns Claude can take in non-interactive mode to prevent infinite loops.

commands.name: --permission-prompt-tool
commands.description: Specifies an MCP tool to handle permission prompts in non-interactive mode, enabling automated workflows.

commands.name: --permission-mode
commands.description: Begin in a specified permission mode. Available modes: acceptEdits, bypassPermissions, default, plan.

commands.name: --append-system-prompt
commands.description: Append a system prompt to the default system prompt.

commands.name: --fallback-model
commands.description: Enable automatic fallback to specified model when default model is overloaded (only works with --print).

commands.name: --ide
commands.description: Automatically connect to IDE on startup if exactly one valid IDE is available.

commands.name: --strict-mcp-config
commands.description: Only use MCP servers from --mcp-config, ignoring all other MCP configurations.

commands.name: --session-id
commands.description: Use a specific session ID for the conversation (must be a valid UUID).
